channel.title: What routers work good with p servers... and which dont work at all with them
channel.description:
Im planning on getting a router because Im sick of not being on the server status list and Im sick of nobody knowing my server exists. So far its hamachi... which is *made very clear to the public* to be B-A-D. Well anyway I dont want to go buy one and end up with the wrong thing or a bad one that wont work for shit. Please post some following information for me...
How much is one...? What ones are good...? What ones dont work for p servers...? (if any dont) What router do you use...? (if you have 1)
And possibly any information you think i'd need to make a good purchase.
I know very little about routers, mostly because I overlooked most information about them over time (since I didnt care because I didnt have one anyway). I pretty much only know [i](think)[/i] that they let other computers connect to yours...but thats about it.
Please post so I dont waste a bunch of money and end up with something that doesnt work.

item.title: What routers work good with p servers... and which dont work at all with them
item.dc:creator: @dragster32 dragster32
item.description:
@dragster32 wrote:

what? I have 2 computers =/ and if so can anybody please tell me how. Plus why the hell doesnt everybody use no-ip instead of hamachi theres like 1000 hamachi servers???

Read full topic
item.source: What routers work good with p servers... and which dont work at all with them

item.title: What routers work good with p servers... and which dont work at all with them
item.dc:creator: @KiIIer KiIIer
item.description:
@KiIIer wrote:

You don’t need to buy a router if you don’t have 2 computers. You can set up a no-ip at no-ip.com if you don’t have a router you will not need to port forward. If you only have one computer you should have no problem letting people play your server.

Read full topic
item.source: What routers work good with p servers... and which dont work at all with them
